problem_text:
a) Does there exist a local product (different from the class of all finite groups and from the class of all finite soluble groups) of Fitting classes each of which is not local and is not a formation? See the definition of the product of Fitting classes in (N. T. Vorob’ev, Math. Notes, 43, No 1–2 (1988), 91–94).
N. T. Vorob’¨ev
answer: Yes, there does (N. T. Vorob’ev, A. N. Skiba, Problems in Algebra, 8, Gomel’, 1995, 55–58 (Russian)).
